subtitle.line: FjernsynAf Dave Waddell
TelevisieDoor Dave Waddell
TelevisionBy Dave Waddell
TelevisionBy Dave Waddell

line.words: Alfredo e la mamma di Alfredo sono in salotto. Alfredo sta guardando la televisione. La mamma di Alfredo sta leggendo il giornale.

subtitle.line: Alfredo og Alfredos mor sidder i stuen. Alfredo ser fjernsyn. Alfredos mor læser avisen.
Alfred en zijn moeder zitten in de woonkamer. Alfred kijkt televisie. Alfreds moeder leest de krant.
Alfredo and Alfredo’s Mum are sitting in the lounge. Alfredo is watching television. Alfredo’s Mum is reading the newspaper.
Alfredo and Alfredo’s Mum are sitting in the lounge. Alfredo is watching television. Alfredo’s Mum is reading the newspaper.

line.words: Alfredo sta guardando una puntata dei “Simpsons”. Homer Simpson sta rispondendo ad un sondaggio nel giornale. Legge ad alta voce qualche domanda al suo figlio Bart.

subtitle.line: Alfredo ser en episode med Simpsons. Homer Simpson svarer på spørgsmål fra avisen. Han læser nogle af spørgsmålene højt for sin søn, Bart:
Alfred kijkt een aflevering van The Simpsons. Homer Simpson beantwoordt een enquête in de krant. Hij leest een paar van de vragen voor aan zijn zoon, Bart:
Alfredo is watching an episode of The Simpsons. Homer Simpson is answering a newspaper questionnaire. He reads out some of the questions to his son, Bart:
Alfredo is watching an episode of The Simpsons. Homer Simpson is answering a newspaper questionnaire. He reads out some of the questions to his son, Bart:

line.words: “Bart, come ti chiami? Bart, dove abiti? Bart, quanti anni hai? Bart, ti piace giocare a tennis?” Bart non risponde. Bart se ne va sullo skateboard.

subtitle.line: ”Bart, hvad hedder du? Bart, hvor bor du? Bart, kan du lide pommes fritter? Bart, hvor gammel er du? Bart, kan du lide tennis?”Bart svarer ikke. Han kører af sted på sit skateboard.
“Bart, wat is je naam? Bart, waar woon je? Bart, lust je graag chips? Bart, hoe oud ben je? Bart, hou je van tennis?”Bart geeft geen antwoord. Bart gaat weg met zijn skateboard.
“Bart, what is your name? Bart, where do you live? Bart, do you like chips? Bart, how old are you? Bart, do you like tennis?”Bart does not answer. Bart goes off on his skateboard.
“Bart, what is your name? Bart, where do you live? Bart, do you like chips? Bart, how old are you? Bart, do you like tennis?”Bart does not answer. Bart goes off on his skateboard.

line.words: Alfredo ride forte. “Amo guardare la tivù” dice Alfredo. “È fantastico.”

subtitle.line: Alfredo griner højt.”Jeg elsker at se TV”, siger Alfredo. ”Det er genialt.”
Alfred lacht hardop.“Ik ben gek op televisie kijken,” zegt Alfred. “Het is geweldig.”
Alfredo laughs loudly.“I love watching TV,” says Alfredo. “It’s brilliant.”
Alfredo laughs loudly.“I love watching TV,” says Alfredo. “It’s brilliant.”

line.words: La mamma di Alfredo alza lo sguardo. “Amo leggere il giornale. Puoi abbassare la tivù, per favore. Mi dà fastidio” dice la mamma di Alfredo.

subtitle.line: Alfredos mor ser op. ”Jeg elsker at læse avis. Kan du lige skrue lidt ned for TVet? Det er irriterende”, siger Alfredos mor.
Alfreds moeder kijkt op. “Ik lees graag de krant. Kan je de tv iets zachter zetten, alsjeblieft? Het is vervelend,” zegt Alfreds moeder.
Alfredo’s Mum looks up. “I love reading the newspaper. Could you turn the TV down, please? It’s annoying,” says Alfredo’s Mum.
Alfredo’s Mum looks up. “I love reading the newspaper. Could you turn the TV down, please? It’s annoying,” says Alfredo’s Mum.

line.words: Alfredo alza il volume della tivù. “AMO PATATE FRITTE! ABITO A LONDRA! dice Homer Simpson. Alfredo ride forte.

subtitle.line: Alfredo skruer op for TVet. ”Jeg ELSKER POMMES FRITTER! JEG BOR I LONDON!” siger Homer Simpson. Alfredo griner højt.
Alfred zet de tv nog wat harder. “IK LUST GRAAG CHIPS! IK WOON IN LONDEN!” zegt Homer Simpson. Alfred lacht hard.
Alfredo turns the TV up. “I LOVE CHIPS! I LIVE IN LONDON!” says Homer Simpson. Alfredo laughs loudly.
Alfredo turns the TV up. “I LOVE CHIPS! I LIVE IN LONDON!” says Homer Simpson. Alfredo laughs loudly.

line.words: “Alfredo!” dice la mamma di Alfredo. “Sto provando di leggere.” “E io sto provando di guardare la tivù”, dice Alfredo.

subtitle.line: “Alfredo!”, siger Alfredos mor. ”Jeg prøver på at læse.””Og jeg prøver på at se TV”, siger Alfredo.
“Alfred!” zegt Alfreds moeder. “Ik probeer te lezen.”“En ik probeer te kijken,” zegt Alfred.
“Alfredo!” says Alfredo’s Mum. “I am trying to read.”“And I’m trying to watch,” says Alfredo.
“Alfredo!” says Alfredo’s Mum. “I am trying to read.”“And I’m trying to watch,” says Alfredo.

line.words: “Comunque”, dice Alfredo, “perchè stai leggendo il giornale quando puoi guardare la tivù? Anche la mia professore non piace il giornale. A dire il vero, piace “I Simpsons”.

subtitle.line: ”Hvorfor læse, når man kan se TV? Selv min lærer kan ikke lide aviser. Hun kan faktisk godt lide Simpsons
“Bovendien,” zegt Alfred, “waarom zou je lezen als je tv kan kijken? Zelfs mijn juf leest niet graag de krant. Zij vindt The Simpsons leuk.”
“Anyway,” says Alfredo, “why read when you can watch TV? Even my teacher doesn’t like the newspaper. She actually likes The Simpsons ”
“Anyway,” says Alfredo, “why read when you can watch TV? Even my teacher doesn’t like the newspaper. She actually likes The Simpsons ”

line.words: La mamma di Alfredo fa un sospiro a lungo. Si toglie gli occhiali. “Giornali” dice la mamma di Alfredo, “sono pieno di cose interessanti e importanti –

subtitle.line: Alfredos mor sukker dybt. Hun tager brillerne af. ”Aviser”, siger Alfredos mor, ”er fulde af interessante og vigtige ting –
Alfreds moeder slaakt een diepe zucht. Ze zet haar bril af. “Kranten,” zegt Alfreds moeder, “staan vol met interessante en belangrijke dingen –
“Anyway,” says Alfredo, “why read when you can watch TV? Even my teacher doesn’t like the newspaper. She actually likes The Simpsons ”
Alfredo’s Mum lets out a long sigh. She takes off her glasses. “Newspapers,” says Alfredo’s Mum, “are full of interesting and important things

line.words: come istruzione, attualità, lo sport, il viaggio, la cucina, il giardinaggio, il tempo, soldi e moda.”

subtitle.line: som uddannelse, nyheder, sport, rejser,mad, have, kultur, vejret, penge og mode.”
zoals onderwijs, sport, reizen, kookkunst, tuinieren, cultuur, het weer, geld en mode.”
like education, current affairs, sports, travel, cookery, gardening, culture, the weather, money and fashion.”
like education, current affairs, sports, travel, cookery, gardening, culture, the weather, money and fashion.”

line.words: La mamma di Alfredo assume una voce importante: “Secondo me, Alfredo, la televisione è troppo semplicistica. I giornali sono pieno di storie fantastiche, belle immagine.

subtitle.line: Alfredos mor siger med betydningsfuld stemme: “Efter min mening, Alfredo, er fjernsyn for simpelt. Aviser er fulde af fantastiske historier, smukke billeder.
Alfreds moeder zegt met een belangrijk klinkende stem: “Volgens mij, Alfred, is televisie te simpel. Kranten staan vol met fantastische verhalen, mooie foto’s.
Alfredo’s Mum puts on an important sounding voice: “In my opinion, Alfredo, television is too simplistic. Newspapers are full of fantastic stories, beautiful pictures.
Alfredo’s Mum puts on an important sounding voice: “In my opinion, Alfredo, television is too simplistic. Newspapers are full of fantastic stories, beautiful pictures.

line.words: Spesso la televisione rende le cose complicate stupido. Inoltre parla di divertimento nel giornale. Comunque la gente non sa questo. Quindi guardano solo la televisione.”

subtitle.line: Det er tit, at fjernsynet får komplicerede ting til at lyde dumme. Desuden er det sjovt. Men det ved folk ikke. Derfor ser de bare fjernsyn.
Vaak laat de televisie moeilijke dingen dom klinken. Bovendien gaat het alleen om vermaak. Maar de mensen weten dit niet. Daarom kijken ze gewoon tv.”
Often, television makes complicated things sound dumb. In addition, it is all about fun. However, people don’t know this. Therefore, they just watch television.”
Often, television makes complicated things sound dumb. In addition, it is all about fun. However, people don’t know this. Therefore, they just watch television.”

line.words: La mamma di Alfredo si è soddisfatta. Raddrizza il giornale. La mamma di Alfredo si mette gli occhiali. La mamma di Alfredo comincia ancora a leggere.

subtitle.line: Alfredos mor er meget tilfreds med sig selv. Hun folder avisen ud. Alfredos mor tager brillerne på igen. Alfredos mor begynder at læse igen.
Alfreds moeder is erg blij met zichzelf. Ze strijkt de krant glad. Alfreds moeder zet haar bril op. Ze gaat weer verder lezen.
Alfredo’s Mum is very pleased with herself. She straightens the newspaper. Alfredo’s Mum puts her glasses on. Alfredo’s Mum starts to read again.
Alfredo’s Mum is very pleased with herself. She straightens the newspaper. Alfredo’s Mum puts her glasses on. Alfredo’s Mum starts to read again.

line.words: “Ciononostante” dice Alfredo imitando la voce importante di sua mamma, “la televisione è anche molto divertente. Guarda, per esempio a proprio quello che sta facendo Homer.”

subtitle.line: “Ikke desto mindre”, siger Alfredo med sin mors betydningsfulde stemme, ”er fjernsynet også sjovt. Prøv for eksempel at se, hvad Homer laver lige nu.”
“En toch,” zegt Alfred, met dezelfde stem als zijn moeder, “televisie is ook heel grappig. Kijk bijvoorbeeld naar wat Homer nu doet.”
“Nevertheless,” says Alfredo, in his Mum’s important sounding voice, “television is also very funny. Look, for example, at what Homer is doing right now.”
“Nevertheless,” says Alfredo, in his Mum’s important sounding voice, “television is also very funny. Look, for example, at what Homer is doing right now.”

line.words: La mamma di Alfredo fa un sospiro a lungo. Si toglie gli occhiali. Guarda alla televisione. Homer Simpson si veste in pigiama. Sta in piedi su una sedia. Sta mangiando il giornale. “Duh” dice Homer.

subtitle.line: Alfredos mor sukker dybt. Hun tager brillerne af. Hun kigger på fjernsynet. Homer Simpson har kun pyjamasbukser på. Han står på en stol. Han spiser avisen. ”Duh!” siger Homer.

Alfreds moeder slaakt een diepe zucht. Ze zet haar bril af. Ze kijkt naar de televisie. Homer Simpson draagt alleen een pyjamabroek. Hij staat op een stoel. Hij eet de krant op. “Duh!” zegt Homer. Alfredo’s Mum lets out a long sigh. She takes off her glasses. She looks at the television. Homer Simpson is dressed in just his pajama bottoms. He is standing on a chair. He is eating the newspaper. “Duh!” says Homer.

Alfredo’s Mum lets out a long sigh. She takes off her glasses. She looks at the television. Homer Simpson is dressed in just his pajama bottoms. He is standing on a chair. He is eating the newspaper. “Duh!” says Homer.

Alfredo’s Mum lets out a long sigh. She takes off her glasses. She looks at the television. Homer Simpson is dressed in just his pajama bottoms. He is standing on a chair. He is eating the newspaper. “Duh!” says Homer.
Alfredos mor smiler.
Alfreds moeder lacht.
Alfredo’s Mum smiles.
Alfredo’s Mum smiles.

line.words: La mamma di Alfredo fa un grande sorriso.

subtitle.line: Alfredos mor griner.
Alfreds moeder grijnst.
Alfredo’s Mum grins.
Alfredo’s Mum grins.

line.words: La mamma di Alfredo ride molto forte.

subtitle.line: Alfredos mor ler meget højt.
Alfreds moeder lacht heel hard.
Alfredo’s Mum laughs very loudly.
Alfredo’s Mum laughs very loudly.
The end.
The end.
